result.execSummary:
The defendant Orlando Luis Pacheco was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Submit a DNA sample by 5pm on 8-12-2022 and pay the surcharge by 2-13-2023. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.

Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges by 2-13-2023. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Orlando Luis Pacheco

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Orlando Luis Pacheco in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO COUNT 1:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.
AS TO COUNT 2:
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
Defendant ordered to serve 60 DAYS in the House of Correction, credit of 70 days TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

- Submit a DNA sample by 5pm on 8/12/2022 and pay the surcharge by 02/13/2023.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Court waived all NON-MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges.
- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges by 02/13/2023. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea and Jury Instructions. filed.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Pretrial Incarceration Credit, filed.

Defendant Orlando Luis Pacheco in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  
Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: RMM.
Status conference held.  Atty. Fuentes has received discovery and an offer and requests a plea and sentencing date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 7-21-22, filed.  rmm

Defendant Orlando Luis Pacheco in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  
Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Fuentes has received discovery but no offer and requests a status date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with Jose AM
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Orlando Luis Pacheco in court with attorney Angel L Johnson.  Defendant Orlando Luis Pacheco in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Orlando Luis Pacheco appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
